criterion.metrics-feedback-available: Insights from metrics and feedback are available to optimize existing APIs.
criterion.api-opportunity-documented: Individual API opportunities are identified and documented.
criterion.api-reusability: The API meets a clear business need and is reusable for multiple API consumers.
criterion.hide-backend-discrepancies: The goal of the API is to hide backend data models and discrepancies.
criterion.value-prop-validated: The value proposition validates with key stakeholders.
criterion.consumer-segments-identified: API consumer segments (internal and external) are identified.
criterion.api-roadmap-defined: High-level roadmaps for API development are established.
criterion.architecture-patterns-validate: The API architecture uses patterns that promote reusability and integration, and is validated with stakeholders.
criterion.design-reflects-business-value: The API's design and endpoints have a clear connection to their business value and features.
criterion.api-consistency: API has a consistent design with our other API products.
criterion.api-contract-tested: The API contract is tested and meets functional and non-functional requirements.
criterion.api-description-available: The API and its endpoints have descriptions that explain their business value and features.
criterion.audit-passed: The API passes compliance, security, and audit checks.
criterion.audit-reports-shared: Audit reports are shared with stakeholders.
criterion.api-ready-for-publishing: The API is ready to be published to the appropriate gateways and environments to support reusability for multiple API consumers.
criterion.api-documentation-ready: API documentation is complete and ready for publishing.
criterion.consumer-support-ready: API registration, support, and communication processes are in place.
criterion.legal-compliance-clear: Legal and compliance requirements are precise enough for publishing.
